film.quote: Strong pretender to the title of best horror film of all times.
One of the most powerful movies I've seen. It's also one of the most complete, perfect and simply the best tales created on any medium.

film.filmname: Once Upon a Time in the West
The Treasure of the Sierra Madre

film.quote: A masterpiece thriller: nothing much happens, but the tension is unbearable!

film.filmname: Once Upon a Time in America

film.quote: A fairy-tale retold. As many musicals of the age, this one's about making one - this time from the classic Andersen story, and once again, life copies fiction.
May well be the best (or at least best filmed) costume film ever.

film.filmname: Dr. Strangelove or: How I Learned to Stop Worrying and Love the Bomb

film.quote: Absolutely classic film noir. Worth seeing especially for the gripping half-an-hour heist scene without any dialog or music.
Best from Ghibli! Enthralling and visually stunning story which keeps us in awe for the creators' imagination.

film.filmname: The Life and Death of Colonel Blimp
film.quote: Ah! An old-school (meaning passee) film about old-school (again, passee) warfare - how ironic. It's a great story about aging of a man and his ideas, about how the world we knew is no longer - in this case the world of warfare as a gentlemens fair-play sport, and the only example I know of that art and propaganda can go together.

Imagine Humphrey Bogart as a humanoid pig... it's a combination of romantic drama, humor and dying past. Makes you thing of Casablanca, but has much more to offer - all the details which may seem random or insignificant actually add to the meaning and there are layers to this film. My personal Miyazaki favourite.

film.filmname: The Good, the Bad and the Ugly
I Am a Fugitive from a Chain Gang
The Man Who Shot Liberty Valance
The Man Who Would Be King

film.quote: A hilarious film, gradually developing from a bergmanesque story into utter absurd.

film.filmname: The Bridge on the River Kwai
Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind
Monty Python and the Holy Grail

film.quote: One of the best movies of the kind 'intermingled stories of several people' - original and interesting characters in stories with a balanced mix of drama and humor, which actually fits together well.
Most accessible Tarkovsky I've seen, and a great war film making heavier impression then many without actually showing any fighting.
By far the best zorro film of all

I loved how it was humorous while not comical, serious and yet not dramatic, optimistic without falling into cliche. The light approach it takes at a grave subject is a good lesson on how things commonly regarded as 'tragedies' aren't the end of the world after all. Coupled with a great script and strong acting it makes a very good, unpretentious story in which all characters, although often eccentric, feel like real people living real lives, which is something you can rarely say about a film.
A comedy as black as it gets, exceeding heavily the limits of political corectness - tastlessness with taste.

A great film on growing up, finding the meaning of friendship, love and principles. Both lead characters and the dog are extremely likable and should easily appeal to viewers of all ages. However, with an interesting non-linear narration, good guitar music, Jerusalem in the background and strong performances by all the cast (kudos to debuting Bar Belfer here), it is much more then a casual date film and should be remembered.

film.filmname: Spring, Summer, Fall, Winter... and Spring
The Man With A Movie Camera

film.quote: You may see the seams, and it by no means aspires to the name of a work of art, but it sure hits the target. A great narration paired with skillfully chosen music and camerawork forms one of the most powerful and emphatic films I've seen. Be warned - it's also one of the most cynical.
Very original and provocative at the time of release (pre-reality show), probably less appealing now to those taking their existence for granted.
Grace Kelly and Cary Grant in a feature that clearly shows how much James Bond films where inspired by Hitchcock's work

A very subtle and amusing story of an egyptian traditional orchestra lost somewhere in Isreal. The director, fascinated by arabic music, decided to tell a story not only featuring it, by also resembling it - one very reserved in form, but grave and emotional in content.
Some films, whatever their flaws, just have magic in them - this one such film.

film.filmname: The Best Years of Our Lives
film.quote: Wyler shows his skill by perfectly blending drama and comedy in this portrait of three ww2 veterans. All characters are wonderfully drawn and multidimensional, the humor is subtle, the problems it touches realistic, and nothing is simply black and white. Alas, although it's a masterpiece of cinematography, it's also a lengthy film (3 hours), and focusing on problems specific to post-war america, making it hard to relate to for most viewers, and maybe just a bit boring.

It's a very interesting view into the oil business, presenting the issue from multiple points of views: oil companies, american politicians, spies, conservative emirs, progressive reformists in oil-reach countries, terrorists and many more. The story avoids oversimplification to show it points, which makes it so much more powerful. However, the myriads of threads and characters in a not-so-long (2h) film makes the narration very hard to follow - you can't get everything in one seeing.

Cinematographywise, there isn't much special about this film. With music being it's predominant substance, and somebody performing most of the screen time, there's little time left for things like character development. The songs aren't even too tightly woven into the plot, which is quite minimalistic; yet, it avoids cliche and attains a feeling of authenticity. Ultimately, however, whether you'll enjoy it depends solely on how much you're into this type of music.

film.filmname: Lock, Stock and Two Smoking Barrels

film.quote: Finally! A really good film made in Poland. Although the subject of dysfunctional family and difficulty of life in the province has been already widely exploited, this take is subtle, funny at places, and not-at-all pretentious.

film.filmname: Master and Commander: The Far Side of the World
film.quote: A good, no-nonsense adventure film. Oh why don't they make them this way anymore - tough nature and tough men fighting one another

film.filmname: All Quiet on the Western Front
Pirates of the Caribbean: The Curse of the Black Pearl
film.quote: A great triumph of good characterization, film music & Johnny Depp with Goeffrey Rush over bad film making.

film.filmname: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

film.quote: I love the pace of this film - it reminds me of thrillers from years back, which didn't need MTV editing and galloping action to create suspense. The story is simple, but it's good, because it can focus on depicting all characters and tying up all ends nicely. It has been filmed seemingly without artificial lighting and there is virtually no background music in the soundtrack, creating a realistic feeling and depending on acting for ambiance.
A comedy so black, it's not in fact a comedy. An exceptional debut of both the director and the cast - it keeps you fascinated and disgusted till the end.

film.filmname: A Matter of Life and Death
film.quote: A good example of how a film can stand the test of time even when feeling dated, and how it's a good story, not top-notch cinematography which counts.

A lightweight, amusing film answering the question 'what if you find yourself best skilled in a controversial activity, not in line with your otherwise salt-of-the-earth nature' ? A sequence of laughs everybody will like thanks to its extremely likable characters.

This film moved me more then "Schindler's List" or "The Pianist", because it doesn't try to overwhelm with the scale of evil that happend during WWII, but decides to leave it solely in the viewer's context, and focuses on a drama of a single refugee boy, trying to cope with his past as and adult writer in Canada. The film doesn't try use over-dramatic acting, action or soundtrack for the effect, remaining toned down and relying on excellent screenplay.

Unarguably one of better Cohen's films. However, it's a bit unique in the fact that it's completely missing comedy elements - even the most ominous characters, grotesque as they are, aren't exactly funny - and that it doesn't form a closed story. It lacks a single culmination point, because all characters are in a sense equally important, and their threads continue after other's have been brutally ended.

There's just enough of crime genre in it to remain entertaining, but it's really a drama - superbly acted and quite disturbing. Still, it's probably a film of a moment, not too likely to be remembered in a decade.

film.filmname: Ghost Dog: The Way of the Samurai

film.quote: A great suspense film from the times when spy movies weren't about blowing helicopters and destroying the world, and one in which you can actually believe the characters.

This isn't a war film - it's an anti-war film. As such, it's completely subordinated to making it's point and portaits all characters as single-dimensional, good or bad. Having said that, it's a great work of cinematography with very powerful filming.

A tasty piece of a film for viewers of all ages. Great thanks to the makers for not taking an easy way of gags and parody to induce laughter - the references in this film are restricted mostly to camerawork and editing, which doesn't make them less funny. It may very well be my favorite pixar animation.

Very original and interesting story of an unhappy comedian who, in order to be treated seriously for once, decides on commiting a desperate act. The film is full of abstract and confusing elements and involves the viewer in the story in a way similar to 'Cache' and 'funny games'. A brilliant performance by Michael Youn and one of the best endings I've ever seen.

film.filmname: Cat on a Hot Tin Roof

film.quote: A wonderfully funny, original film
A nice, character-driven western
A nice journey back in time with a sixties/seventies style music film, where most of the script is comprised of some 30 the Beatles songs.

It's amazing, how an action and humour packed gangster film has more to say about guilt, redemption and friendship then most dramas. Entertainment here goes hand in hand with substance and great cinematography - best lately released film.
A Russian version of tough-guy films. Fresh and cute.

The problem with biographies is that life is a screen-writer not knowing the rules of the job, and thus the plot often lacks proper escalation of tension or turning points. This is also the case with "Into The Wild" - the whole film just slowly heads for the inevitable end, without any character evolution or change of the direction. However, the fatum leitmotif is arguably appropriate here, and the film really makes the most of the story, skillfully showing the view of both sides.

film.filmname: Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid
The Loneliness of the Long Distance Runner

film.quote: Best teen comedy, ever! And the only with INTELLIGENT humor I've seen - no comparison to the other lot which goes in this category.
A unique film which has to be watched together with Murnau's 'Nosferatu' to be fully appreciated.

film.filmname: Sunrise: A Song of Two Humans
Interview with the Vampire: The Vampire Chronicles

film.quote: A classic among gangster films, offering a lot of small details to look for to film buffs.
One of the best films on Holocaust, and finally one for which Spielberg's pompous style is adequate.

A rare but not uncommon (jar head) breed of a war film - one without an enemy, where little happens and characters spend their time mostly waiting and talking. It's somewhat longish, but when paired with good photography and allegedly realistic portrait of life in an outpost, it works. At the same time, we are a litte bored and anxious about what will come next.

A story of 15 year old Tracey Berkowitz in search for her younger brother, told using a multi-frame composition. The number of frames, as their position, size and content changes throughout the film - sometimes they are exact copies, sometimes they show completely different scenes, or the same scene from different angles, sometimes it's the same scene.
A quite well told, non-banal story, even if it's not among the most memorable films I've seen.

film.filmname: Back to the Future Part III
The Man Who Knew Too Much
Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs

film.quote: A classic - if you consider yourself a film buff, you have to see it, casual viewers will find it boring.

film.filmname: Indiana Jones and the Last Crusade

film.quote: Absolutely great battle sequences, but the message is slapped in your face even more bluntly and literally then in other Spielberg movies. Better to skip pathetic opening and closing sequences.

film.filmname: Wallace & Gromit: The Curse of the Were-Rabbit

film.quote: This film will leave anyone in love with absurd completely enchanted. A great satiric commentary of current situation in the area.

A great fairy tale with pacifistic and ecological theme. Although not as visually stunning as later productions, with a smmilary ringing Mononoke Hime, it is still a kind of film you would like your children to watch. And you, too!
A good, dark story of a murder and sins from the past.

A good and one of the more original 'road movies' I've seen. As it's a chinese film, slapstick and life philosophy (sometimes banal) are interwoven into a story which is at some places funny and sad at others. I quite enjoyed the outcome.
Really funny view of rural Poland, can be enjoyed even by outsiders.
As pleasant as schematic, bearing a strong resamblance to 'The French Connection'

film.filmname: The Diving Bell and the Butterfly

film.quote: Of course it's a romantic comedy and schematic as such, but performances are great and should bring a smile to the face of even a greatest skeptic of the genre.
Some very interesting and unexpected results, although probably without application in feature films.

There are a couple of things you could fault this film with - somewhat single-dimensional characters, mechanical manipulation of emotions by over-expressive soundtrack. Viewers from countries which have some idea about real implementations of comunism looked like will also find it a bit more difficult to relate to the characters. This doesn't change the fact, however, that's a tragicomedy that moves you.
A dostoyevski-like story with standard superb performance from russian actors.

film.filmname: Back to the Future Part II

film.quote: Very well done and genuinely scary, but doesn't introduce anything new to the genre - it's certainly not in the same class as 'The Others' or '6th sense'.

film.filmname: Perfume: The Story of a Murderer

film.quote: A fresh take on martial-arts films; the music is intense, the action fast and the plot actually makes a bit of sense. What's most important, techniques used in fighting scenes are often quite different from what we got used to by the industry monopolized by China, and even though very effective, done mostly without special effects of any sorts.

film.filmname: The Three Burials of Melquiades Estrada

film.quote: It's impossible to sum up the plot in one sentence, because it would say more then there is in the film itself. It's a surprisingly fascinating sequence of beautifully composed, saturated pictures illustrating a story as minimalistic as they go.

Although it lacks the drama and momentum typical to the genre, I quite enjoyed it for several reasons: the simple, almost archetypal plot, a range of colorful characters, and finally - a common theme in P&P works - the nostalgic idea of a war as a duel of skills fought by gentlemen of honor.
One of the best original bonds, and making contemporary productions prudish in comparison!

A story of a man so used to accepting what comes his way and willing to conform, that he takes this approach in an unexpectedly developing relationship. In many ways it's similar to last year's 'Bothersome Man' - they are both grotesque stories of leading mechanical, passive lives. However, 'kvinnen' makes a greater impression by forcing us to laugh in situations we should find most troubling, being at the same time hilarious and depressing. The effect is somewhat spoiled by the ending, though.

A contemporary implementation of a Greek tragedy, where the destiny of the characters is forfeit from the beginning by the fatum. Very drastic in content, but also well filmed and edited, making it's a film you won't easily forget.
A well-watching old-school suspense

film.filmname: The Passion of Joan of Arc
South Park: Bigger, Longer, and Uncut

film.quote: Hard to watch, but possibly the best film to start acquaintance with Jodorovsky - at least it has a plot...

There's everything in it to make it a great film noir: a handsome and tough private eye as the protagonists, evil gangsters, beautiful cars, fast and deadly women and a sinister plot of world importance. The story is quite memorable, but stays in dissonance with schematic realization and over-acted cliche characters, leaving ambivalent feelings. So, instead of securing itself a place among the greatest films noir , it remains just a somewhat standing out example of hundreds similar productions.

I don't deny that Day-Lewis gave a great performance here, but it's about the only one in the film. If you like character-driven films, this is definitely something for you - one of more appalling portraits of human nature in cinema. However, if you expect a good story above all, you may be disappointed - like most films relating a life of a person (with a notable exception of Citizen Kane), it lacks a pronounced culmination point or conclusion.
An intriguing little short, done so professionally, it's hard to believe both the director/writer and the operator have only finished a two-year film school.

A story so weird you can't believe it's based on facts. It presents a crazy family, where conventional role-based relationships have been replaced by a partnership, where the parents are straightforward and sincere to the extreme with their children. This lack of paternal attention and care is a problem for Magnus, who, suffering in childhood from a lung disease, feels the breath of death on his neck every day, feels that the thought of checking out early is growing on him.

film.filmname: Indiana Jones and the Kingdom of the Crystal Skull
film.quote: A decent follow-up to the series. It's certainly not up to the level of the 'Raiders', but it's comparable with the 'Temple'. I was glad to see that the years haven't passed without leaving the mark on Henry Junior - it's like meeting again an old friend after many years.
One of the best Pacino's roles and some of the best acting ever. However, if you take him out there's nothing left to defend itself.

film.filmname: And Now for Something Completely Different

film.quote: It's really hillarious, but starts to feel a bit streched towards the end.

film.filmname: The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring

film.quote: It's not L.A. Confidential, it's not De Palma's best, but it's still a good feature. A rare murder story, in which suspense is based on good performances of the whole cast instead of cheap effects, and all the threads of the plot form a large, complicated knot without any loose ends.

film.filmname: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets
Indiana Jones and the Temple of Doom
Andrew Lloyd Webber's The Phantom of the Opera

film.quote: One of the nicer musicals, but nothing out of ordinary.

film.filmname: Pirates of the Caribbean: At World's End
Vampyr - Der Traum des Allan Grey

film.quote: Very atmospheric and amusing film - for a Pasolini, of course, which means I dosed of only occasionally.

The second sequel manages to keep the level of previous films in the series. The action is fast, viewing pleasurable and far from boring, but it can't change the fact, that there's little to it to differentiate from hundreds other similar productions and there's a good chance you'll forget it as soon as you leave the cinema.

A well-told story which fails to impress. It doesn't matter that it's great technically, if it doesn't say anything new. The viewer simply doesn't carre both for protagonists and other prisoniers in the german concentration camp. Sad, as the story had a potential for a good action drama with Holocaust in the background.
A lovely though pretty sappy fairy tale. A great feeling but forgettable date movie.

A film much in style of '28 grams' and 'crash', with a main theme of anemia/bulimia. Very good realisation with excellent and deep portraits of all characters, but many viewers may find it difficult to relate to them - it's a pity the film doesn't try to take a broader approach and include some other 'bad habits' into the plot to make it more universal.
Tries to tell a perhaps more realistic variation of the Robin Hood story - great kudos for original idea, even if the effect isn't the greatest.

Could be quite good if it didn't steer away into the direction of car chases and spectacular shootouts in which americam boys save the day - business as usual. Still, it's better then you might except from a hollywood film on terrorism, without really bad moments, but definetely below Michael Mann's capabilities.

film.filmname: Sweeney Todd: The Demon Barber of Fleet Street
film.quote: Most bloody musical ever. Although very pitoresque, twisted as any other burton film, something's missing, and it failed to enthrall me. The cast is great, but much better at acting then singing; the story is nice, but all it's turns till the end known in advance.

film.filmname: Berlin: Symphony of a Great City

film.quote: Not as good or original as the first part but still as tough.
A great idea, fantastic Nicholson, but somehow gets lost at the end. Still, it's by far the best werewolf film ever made.
A good, almost classical plot with some good scenes. However, with the exception of a couple of memorable scenes, the result is somewhat boring due to a so-so script.

Nice pictures and music, but somewhat psychodelic, with action taking place in other planes of consciousness. Heavy symbolism and departure from cause-end-effect approach in narration make it a bit hard to watch; I enjoyed it partially because being half asleep at times and thus taking better to the atmosphere.

film.filmname: The Chronicle History of King Henry the Fift with His Battell Fought at Agincourt in France
Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
La Chute de la maison Usher

film.quote: If you expect a crime story with plot twists, or even a Dostoyevskian analysis of a mind of murderer, you'll be dissapointed. This film is more about how you can't really get to know the motifs, and understand the feelings of people you don't know.
Nice piece of old filmmaking, but regrettably not as watchable today as some of the better P&P works.

It's certainly entertaining for polish people, and Warsaw citizens will have tremendous fun in seeing the less presentable side of their city, rarely making it to the screen. Beware you of delicate ears: some of it comes from constant swearing! It may appeal less to foreigners - if you are not interested in seeing the somewhat original life of the dregs of society, the film doesn't have much to offer - the script is weak, characters single dimensional and cliche.

film.filmname: The Curse of the Jade Scorpion
Funuke domo, kanashimi no ai wo misero
film.quote: At times funny, even more often shocking - a twisted and weird story of an uncommon familly. Interesting to watch, but doesn't leave a lasting impression.

I guess every fan of the Simpsons will see this anyway, but if you're not, you'll see a schematic story and mostly unsophisticated jokes. Just a decent film with an occasional flash of brilliant humor.

An interesting and quite original film in the lines of 'Stranger then fiction'. The idea gives way for many amusing situations, but the incredibly holy (on purpose) results in something more like a joke and places it in my eyes definitely below it's cousin.
It's an ok war movie, but can we finally have one without propaganda and phatos? Too stylized to be realistic.

film.filmname: The Story of Marie and Julien

film.quote: Juliette Binoche gave a great performance as a single mother here and the film has more to it for those willing to watch carefully and make their own interpretations. However, what it doesn't offer, is entertainment - after leaving the cinema, I was too tired and bored to think much about it, which makes all the subtleties go amiss. Sadly, much of this fatigue came from the cinematography - a lot of shots obscuring the characters introduce a feeling of discomfort without apparent reason.

film.filmname: Broken Blossoms or The Yellow Man and the Girl
Dr. Mabuse, der Spieler - Ein Bild der Zeit
Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire
Jay and Silent Bob Strike Back

film.quote: It has a lot of potential and takes on difficult and important subject of the role of the church in Christian religion. Sadly, although It starts great, as an easy-to-watch mystery film raising grave questions, the ending is tasteless and ruins the balanced approach by turning into sensational anti-clerical conspiracy - theoretical pamphlet.
It wouldn't be a bad film, if it wasn't so historically inaccurate.
Not bad, but one of thousands made to this template.

A story of a chinese guard, performing executions, and her life. Film, taking inspiration from Kieslowski, touches topics of value of life, redemption and punishment. It's much more straightforward in realisation and - at least for me - more boring than master's work.

A good and well told story about a lonely and simple worker at an old petrol station somewhere in rural Ireland and one tragic summer. It's low pace depicts accurately the kind of life Josie is living, but also makes it feel a bit longish - I think I would prefer it as a short.
It had to be a great story about how many things are stronger then humans, but the studio-made himalayas and a tendency to approach melodrama makes it feel too simplistic nowadays and just dated.
A simple story without any significant moral, but still quite pleasurable to watch - A bit surprising, considering what we mostly see are the three main characters in a snow storm.
Worse then the original film, there's more cliche, but overall the atmosphere is more or less the same.

Don't make the mistake of thinking of it as a retelling the story from the '57 classic film - it's different in many ways, with inclinations more towards action/road film then to a character study, and is much more romantic/idealistic then the original, somewhat surprising considering how simplistic the westerns tended to be back then. For me, it's another sad example of how very decent acting, costumes and filming never will make up for holes in the screenplay.
Although the characters, acting and cinematographyare quite good, the ubiquitous polish tendency to show pretentious stories on miseries of life crushes any good sides of the film.
Quite cute, really

film.filmname: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone
An Unfinished Piece for a Player Piano
film.quote: It was good story by Chehov, but why the hell adapt it? As a story, it was a good read from history of literature point of view; as a contemporary film feels out of it's times and too didactic (this is Michalkov, after all).

Painfully predictable. You'd expect some sort of plot twist in this kind of film, but no - the system to this film is much easier then the one for winning in blackjack. Still, it's quite entertaining and a decent Friday night popcorn flick.

film.filmname: Pirates of the Caribbean: Dead Man's Chest
The Lord of the Rings: The Return of the King
The Lord of the Rings: The Two Towers
Zero de conduite: Jeunes diables au college
Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix
film.quote: Considering that the longest Harry Potter novel became one of the shortest adaptations, its fast pace was to be expected - the film is galloping from one crucial story point to another, cutting everything possible in between. Still, it's done reasonably well, and although someone who had not read the book may have trouble following or at least enjoying the film, they probably wouldn't be in the audience for the first place, would they?

film.filmname: The Story of the Weeping Camel
The Battle of the River Plate
film.quote: The portrait of captains of enemy ships as charismatic gentlemen from the Nelson era matching their skills in naval warfare has a lot of potential, but the film fails to take advantage of it. Felt too long and rather on the boring side.

film.filmname: Star Wars: Episode III - Revenge of the Sith

film.quote: It's not that it's bad, it's just that it's predictable and not fresh or distinguishable from others
Disappointing - a lot of comic potential in the story left unused, and humorous roles where overplayed to the extent of grotesque.

In order to work, this kind of drama has to feel real. But how can you believe in the story, if characters are cliche, and all activities taken by the leading pair filmed Hollywood-style, with lots of action but no credibility? Even if you forget ludicrous car race scene or skydiving conversations, there's still the Everest climb as a trip for people of all ages. Solo ascent by a middle-aged accountant? You must be joking. An average and pretentious flick, despite great cast.
Among 'poetical' films - meaning no plot or sense in particular scenes - this one is quite watchable and interesting in it's way. This is also because it's not excessively long.

film.filmname: The Life Aquatic with Steve Zissou
Star Wars: Episode II - Attack of the Clones

film.quote: A lot of unused potential and so-so acting
Interesting mostly because of it's view into the life of villagers in Bangladesh, not seen to often on film.
As a short, it would be quite interesting - as it is, there isn't enough to acquire our attantion. Still, being only 67 minutes long, it's watchable.

film.filmname: The Gospel According to St. Matthew

film.quote: http://imdb.com/title/tt0023663/

Full of symbols, and bringing to mind the poetic realism of Murakami's novels - that's what this film's fans say. My impression, strenghened by the meeting with the director, is that those symbols are quite random, not fitting together to form a bigger whole. Instead, whatever felt important to the director at the time made it to the film, resulting in a very personal work, maybe atmospheric and interesting as a depiction of what happens in someone's soul, but without a deepe

film.filmname: Once Upon a Time in Mexico
The Chronicles of Narnia: The Lion, the Witch and the Wardrobe
Borat: Cultural Learnings of America for Make Benefit Glorious Nation of Kazakhstan
The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy
Star Wars: Episode I - The Phantom Menace

film.quote: Lacks the freshness and power of '28 days later' - there's little to tell it apart from other zombie movies. And how many film's can one watch about U.S. G.I's saving the world?

Lynch paying tribute to himself. His technique, mastery in conveying emotions by camerawork and music, as well as his skill in interwining different planes of the story are to be admired. However, three hours of psychodelic images forming a riddle seemingly without - unlike 'Mullholland Drive' - a solution was just too much for me and the admiration become boredom at the end.
I've seen many similar, multi-plot, depressing stories from the region, but found none of them so boring and meaningless.
What, in design, was meant to be a poetic contemplation of empathy, joy of living and savoring the moment, sadly turned out to be one of the most boring films I've ever seen.
A story of several youg women pursuing love and happiness in Tokyo, with obligatory in japanese films neglige, peeing and sex scenes.
http://imdb.com/title/tt0057899/

Brings Lynch works into mind. Still, however technically great it may be, it's not half as deep or witty as it thinks it is, and anybody expecting a brilliant solution to such an elaborated riddle will be seriously disappointed.

film.filmname: Ski Jumping Pairs: Road to Torino 2006

film.quote: Most silent films feel vary silly nowadays and this is no exception. However, it is an interesting narration for those times, and worth watching at least for witnessing the proclamation of Socialist Republic of Mars.
This is a hit or miss unconventional comedy - I personally found it's semi-deep existential dillemas where far from convincing.

Comic book adaptations are almost inherently ludicrous as a genre, but what the good ones lack in credibility or character study, they more then make up for in atmosphere, ingenious directing and action. There's a decent amount of the latter (as cliche as it gets, of course), but it has no magic of Burton's or Nolan's Batman, or Spider-man. Overall, I found it a rather boring and average film, the more annoying for its prominent US World Police propaganda, impudent considering current situation.
In this film Kim Ki-duk passes the border from metaphorical to pathetic.
Not of interest to people outside of Romenia (or East-block), with exception of exotic viewing during a filmfest.

film.filmname: Tabu: A Story of the South Seas
film.quote: Maybe it is a classic, but it's also extremely boring.
Good, though not extraordinary choreography, and not much anything else.
Experiments with surrealism in cinema - exclusively for courses in history of cinema.

Not as bad as one might expect - in fact, it's not much more ridiculous then every other hollywood film. Regretfully, it's evidently targeted at under-13 brainwashed males instead of somewhat older geeks, and pompous, pathetic narration by Optimus Prime makes it worse then it could be. But again, it's not that far from previous 'armageddon' movies we've seen.
http://imdb.com/title/tt0084901/
Gilliam's idea behind the film was supposedly to show how resilient the children are. Well, definitely much more then most viewers.

The only good side to this film is Ludivine Sagnier as Tinker Bell, who does a great job and makes you smile whenever she's on the screen. Sadly, it amounts to maybe a minute altogether, if you exclude the time she's just a tiny speck flying around.

film.filmname: In the Realm of the Senses
film.quote: A thin line from pornography - only for those interested how far one can get.
That's what you get when poets start using celluloid tape instead of sticking to paper...
Maybe it's not unbearable, but I see no point in watching it.

film.filmname: Arrivee d'un train a La Ciotat, L'

film.quote: Stallone reminds me of Hayden Christensen here - manages beautifully to keep exactly the same face expression throughout the whole film. I won't comment on the story-line, because it's even simpler then in previous installations - there isn't even one turn point here. As for action - if you've seen the trailer, you've seen everything.

Although it touches subjects which will feel personal to many, thus increasing it's ranking, and it incorporates some fresh and interesting ideas, there are maybe 15 minutes total of non-pathetic material. See 'Dzien Swira' ('Day of a Wacko') instead.

I guess this film is still remembered because of being the first russian musical comedy - I see no reason why this medicore picture should not be forgot. Only for those curious how the russians approached an american genre.

film.filmname: Lara Croft Tomb Raider: The Cradle of Life
Home Alone 2: Lost in New York

film.quote: Maybe I'm just to old to enjoy it, but I found it one of the worst animation films I've seen. Definitely unwatchable for grown-ups.
This is all but unwatchable

The only time in history I left a screening before its end. The film consists of about a dozen scenes, made in one shot using static camera, showing random situations. The photography isn't interesting, and the most action we get is when someone crosses the screen from one border of the frame to another.
